+ Gorilla Glass 4

+ Aluminium Frame

- No Removable Back & Battery

- No Micro SD

+ 5.1 Inch 1440p Display

+ 8 Core CPU

+ 3GB RAM

+ Wireless Qi Charging

It has to be at least a 2900 mAH battery in my opinion considering the entire back of the phone is blocked off from any features like removable battery, micro sd, sim card slot, etc.

hijacker wrote: ↑- No Removable Back & Battery

- No Micro SD

I really don't regret my purchase of the Note 4 anymore.

It could be pro and con for some, i personally don't really need MicroSD if the phone comes in the 32GB/64GB variants, if it comes in 16GB then i'd question them releasing that. If the phone is overall more durable and nicer with a decent sized battery then that's totally fine with me also without a removable battery/back piece.

Well today is the day!

Samsung launched their S6 and S6 Edge as expected.

[QUOTE]Both sport bodies hewn of aluminum, sandwiched between two layers of Gorilla Glass 4. Both sport 5.1-inch Quad HD Super AMOLED screens (more on them later). Both have Samsung's latest octacore chipset thrumming away in them, chipsets that pairs a quad 2.1GHz processor with a Quad 1.5Ghz one. (Oh, and they've both got 3GB of RAM as just for good measure). Both support LTE cat. 6. Both are slated for a global launch on April 10. You get where I'm going with this. Thing is, one is staggeringly more pretty than the other.[/QUOTE]

Here's Android Authority's hands-on..

[SPOILER]They're absolutely in love with the Edge![/SPOILER]

I'm guessing $249 ($749) & $299 ($799) for the Edge.

The lack of microSD support, non-removable back & glass surprised me. I guess if Apple could do it why can't they.

Like with the Note Edge, I wanted it but couldn't wait 2-3 months so hopefully Samsung launches both.

"I'll put up color bars before I'll put you in front of our cameras."

- MacKenzie

The Edge takes the edge over the S6 in the battery department; at least in capacity but perhaps it's screen will use more juice. (The S5 had a 2,800 mAh battery.)

[QUOTE]The Galaxy S6 comes with a 2,550 mAh non-removable battery while the Galaxy S6 Edge comes with a larger 2,600 mAh battery. [/QUOTE]

Remaining unannounced were the storage capacities that each model will be available in. With the removal of the SD card slot there is question what sizes will be available and their respective costs. 16GB? 32GB? 64GB? 128GB?

It's an interesting strategy for Samsung to remove the S6's dustproof and waterproof capabilities. It's a definite positioning move to place the Galaxy line below the Note line; but why?
